reasoning: Grade III meningiomas represent atypical/malignant meningiomas, accounting for ~8-10% of all meningiomas. Global meningioma incidence is ~8-10 per 100k; Grade III subset approximately 0.8 per 100k. Specific age-stratified incidence data for adult Grade III limited in epidemiological literature.
source: Meningioma epidemiology estimates based on tumor registry proportions
